Create the Bland-Altman plot

bland_altman_plot.Rd

This function facilitates creating the Bland-Altman plot for two methods using only three arguments.

bland_altman_plot(group1, group2, colour)

Arguments

group1

A vector with the numeric values of the target method (here, the consistency model).
group2

A vector with the numeric values of the reference method (here, the unrelated mean effects model).
colour

A string to define the colour of the data points in the plot.

Value

Bland-Altman plot on the posterior mean deviance contribution of the individual data points under the consistency model and the unrelated mean effects model. Each data point corresponds to a trial-arm indicated by a pair of numbers. The first number refers to the trial position in the dataset, and the second arm refers to the corresponding trial-arm (see 'Arguments' and 'Value' in data_preparation). The plot also displays the average bias and the 95% limits of agreement with horizontal solid black lines.

Details

bland_altman_plot is integrated in the ume_plot function to create the Bland-Altman plot on the posterior mean of deviance under the consistency model (via run_model) and the unrelated mean effects model (via run_ume).

A uniform scattering of the data points within the 95% limits of agreement and average bias close to 0 indicate that the compared models have a good agreement. Data points positioned above or below the 95% limits of agreement correspond to trials that contribute to the poor fit of the consistency model or unrelated mean effects model, respectively.

References

Bland JM, Altman DG. Measuring agreement in method comparison studies. Stat Methods Med Res 1999;8:135--60

See also

data_preparation, ume_plot, run_model, run_ume .

Author

Loukia M. Spineli
